content: Policies CPF Retirement Loans Property Asked by AnonymousAsked on 10 Oct 2018How do I maximise CPF for retirement beside topping up SA? My risk appetite: low~moderate. (Currently have OA:$105K, OA Inv:$120K; SA:$155K, SA Inv:$18K)Mthly pay $3.5K, bonus avg.5 mths. How to maximise CPF for retirement while getting a flat for someone age 43? Feasible to get a flat of $400K with max loan yrs?  Hv ins cov > $1mil, so should not incur mortgage int.1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 11 Oct 2018You can invest your OA into Funds or ETFs, where you should typically expect a range of 5 - 10% annualized (otherwise it wouldn't be worth investing them). ​I do offer these options, so you can always nudge me here if you want to look at funds that have this kind of performance. ​https://www.facebook.com/luke.ho.54 ​​0 comments1
